tasks: Document your learning in a journal
Practice Collaboration & Communication through small projects
Get feedback from peers or mentors
Analyze case studies in your focus area
Apply new skills to a real project
Create a portfolio piece showcasing your work
Share your progress with the community
Review and reflect on your growth

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, your role is to uncover innovative solutions by immersing yourself in user needs and pain points. To excel in this position, focus on developing a solid foundation in UX fundamentals, UI craft, and collaboration skills, while continuously seeking opportunities for growth and learning.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Hick's Law and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Applying Hick's Law to optimize button sizes and layout for better user experience.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing websites that have successfully applied Hick's Law in their design.
Create a wireframe of a login form with varying button sizes and measure the impact on user behavior using A/B testing.
Design an experiment to test the effect of Hick's Law on user performance and document findings.

topics.name: Aesthetic-Usability Effect: Designing for Emotional Engagement
topics.summary: Using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to create an emotionally engaging user interface that balances form and function.
practice_points: Conduct 3 usability testing sessions with participants who have strong opinions on color schemes and analyze their feedback using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect framework.
Create a mood board with 5 inspiring color palettes and use them to design an interactive prototype that incorporates the Aesthetic-Usability Effect.
Design an experiment to test the impact of color scheme on user engagement and document findings.

topics.name: Law of Proximity: Organizing Content for Clarity
topics.summary: Applying the Law of Proximity to organize content in a clear and concise manner, reducing cognitive load on users.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing websites that have successfully applied the Law of Proximity in their design.
Create a wireframe of an information dashboard with grouped related elements using the Law of Proximity and measure the impact on user behavior using A/B testing.
Design an experiment to test the effect of proximity on user comprehension and document findings.
